author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) has filed defamation suits in the Delhi High Court against Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Bharatiya Janata Party MP Kirti Azad for allegedly making defamatory remarks.

According to DDCA treasurer Ravinder Manchanda, a civil defamation suit against Mr. Kejriwal and Mr. Azad has been filed claiming damages of Rs. 2.5 crore against each.

“The CM and Kirti Azad have put our association to disrepute with such baseless allegations of sexual favour and exchange of money for selection. We would like to know who asked for sexual favours and from whom. We have never heard of any selector asking for sexual favours or money for picking a player. Let them give us evidence. You can't make such outrageous charges without proof,” Mr. Manchanda told The Hindu .

Union Minister Arun Jaitley has also filed a defamation case against Kejriwal
title: DDCA files suits against Kejriwal, Azad
